definition: to observe and emulate/to study (esp. following sb's example)
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: Static if so, can also observe the rewards Jing Lai indus.
sentences.chinese: 静若如此，可赏景来亦可观摩梧桐之文。

sentences.english: Students could see the artistic process directly, in its moment-to-moment fullness.
sentences.chinese: 学生们可直接观摩创作全过程每一分每一秒的情景。

sentences.english: The engraved stone was originally embedded in the wall of the South Building in Lianchi School for learners to view and emulate.
sentences.chinese: 刻石原嵌于莲池书院南楼壁间，意在为后学者观摩。

sentences.english: The MSK Eye Clinic always welcomes the guests to witness the on-the-spot observation on each operation day.
sentences.chinese: 明视康眼科欢迎您每逢手术日现场观摩。

sentences.english: An exhibition of the works of Huang Binhong is held in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 黄宾虹作品观摩会在上海开幕。

sentences.english: Participants also watched the Fang Guosheng studio.
sentences.chinese: 与会人员还观摩了方国胜工作室。

sentences.english: Thanks for Patty's industrious work on the demo.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢珮琳在观摩上的用心和努力。

sentences.english: Elsewhere, DeLinda escorts her sheepishly innocent Amish cousin as he sows his oats on the Vegas strip before returning to the simple life.
sentences.chinese: 狄莲娜因表弟到访带他观摩拉斯维加斯的夜生活。

sentences.english: Teardowns provide a look inside a device and should not be used as disassembly instructions.
sentences.chinese: 拆解设备提供内部观摩，不应被视为反组装指引用。

sentences.english: The German film and TV programs also attracted many visitors.
sentences.chinese: 随后进行的德国影视节目展播吸引了大批来宾观摩。

definition: to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
to have an informal discussion/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
to visit (a meeting, class, trial etc)
to view/to look at/to look sth over
